b) Let G be a group generated by a finite set S, and let l(g) denote the word length function of g ∈ G with respect to S. The group G is said to be contracting if there exist a faithful action of G on the set X∗ of finite words over a finite alphabet X and constants 0 < λ < 1 and C > 0 such that for every g ∈ G and x ∈ X there exist h ∈ G and y ∈ X such that l(h) < λl(g) + C and g(xw) = yh(w) for all w ∈ X∗. Do there exist non-amenable contracting groups?
V. V. Nekrashevich
